dict.string:
readonly timestamp=$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M-") readonly uuid=${"$(uuidgen)":l:gs/\-/} readonly archive="${alfred_workflow_data}/archive" readonly archived_chat_file="${archive}/${timestamp}${uuid}.json" readonly chat_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/chat.json" readonly stream_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/stream.txt"
[[ -d "$archive" ]] || mkdir -p "$archive"
# case: keep starting new conversations if [[ -a "$chat_file" ]]; then if [[ $enable_archiving -eq 1 ]]; then mv "$chat_file" "$archived_chat_file" else rm "$chat_file" fi fi
if [[ -a "$stream_file" ]]; then rm "${stream_file}" fi
echo -n "$1"
⏎ Ask question · ⌘⏎ New chat · ⌥⏎ View history · ⇧⌥⏎ Stop

stream_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/stream.txt" pid_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/pid.txt" # chat_file="${alfred_workflow_cache}/chat.json"
if [[ -a "$pid_file" ]]; then pid="$(< "${pid_file}")" kill $pid /bin/rm "${pid_file}" fi
if [[ -a "$stream_file" ]]; then #stream_file_contents="$(< ${stream_file})" #/bin/rm "${stream_file}" echo -n "\n\n__[Interrupted]__[MESSAGE_STOP]" > $stream_file fi

readonly cache="$alfred_workflow_cache" readonly log_file="${cache}/pull_progress.txt" readonly info_file="${cache}/pull_info.txt" readonly canceled_file="${cache}/pull_canceled.txt"
echo -n "$1" > "$info_file"
# ollama pull "$1" &> >(tee "$log_file" > /dev/null) & ollama pull "$1" &> "$log_file" &
# # Not the PID of the actual pull process. # # We cannot use it to cancel the download # # but to confirm that it is still running. pid=$!
while ps -p $pid > /dev/null; do sleep 1 done
# # End the process if it is still lingering. if ps -p $pid > /dev/null; then # kill $pid killall ollama fi
/bin/rm $log_file /bin/rm $info_file
if [[ -f $canceled_file ]]; then /bin/rm $canceled_file echo -n "Download Canceled"
else echo -n "Download Complete" fi

readonly timestamp=$(date +"%Y%m%d-%H%M-") readonly uuid=${"$(uuidgen)":l:gs/\-/} readonly archive="${alfred_workflow_data}/archive" readonly archive_chat="${archive}/${timestamp}${uuid}.json" readonly chat_file_current="${alfred_workflow_cache}/chat.json" readonly chat_file_from_archive="$1"
# case: # Return to the archived chat selection script filter # from the chat text view after pressing escape (stacked view). # The desired archived chat already is the current chat, # the script filter just has not been updated to reflect that. # # WARNING # Correction, stacking has to be disabled for now as it may # lead to data loss. I.e. disallow the window behaviour: # `Don't close the Alfred Window on actioning result`. # Needs further testing. However, the results are at least # inconsistent with stacking is enabled. #
if [[ ! -a "$chat_file_from_archive" ]]; then exit 0 fi
# case: keep starting new conversations if [[ -a "$chat_file_current" ]]; then mv "$chat_file_current" "$archive_chat" fi
mv "$chat_file_from_archive" "$chat_file_current"
if command -v swiftc &>/dev/null; then [[ -f ./src/Archive ]] || swiftc -O ./src/Archive.swift -o ./src/Archive ./src/Archive "$1" else swift ./src/Archive.swift "$1" # unusable fi

ascript=$(cat <<EOF | osascript tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" set theWorkflow to "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" set modelPreference to "chat_preferred_model" set theModel to "$1" set configuration modelPreference to value theModel in workflow theWorkflow reload workflow theWorkflow end tell EOF )
osascript -e "$ascript"

![](icon-hat.png)
# Alfred Ollama
--- Created by [Patrick Sy](https://github.com/zeitlings) | [Github](https://github.com/zeitlings/alfred-ollama) | [Alfred Forum](https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/21851-ollama/) | [Buy me a Coffee](https://ko-fi.com/zeitlings) ☕ ---
Dehydrated [Ollama](https://ollama.com/) Command Line Interface interface 1. Manage your local language models 2. Perform local inference through Alfred
## Requirements
The Ollama [macOS application](https://ollama.com/download), at least one installed [model](https://ollama.com/library) for chat or other inference tasks, and the Xcode Command Line Tools.¹ To modify or add custom inference actions to the workflow's [universal action](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/), install [pkl](https://pkl-lang.org/main/current/pkl-cli/index.html#homebrew), edit the configuration file and build the inference tasks.
## Usage
Manage your local models or chat with them via the `ollama` keyword. Alternatively, define [Hotkeys](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) for quick access.
![Ollama workflow entry](images/preview1.png)
- <kbd>↩</kbd> Continue conversation. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Start or quit Ollama. - <kbd>⌥</kbd> View Ollama version.
### Local Models
![Ollama installed models](images/preview2.png)
- <kbd>↩</kbd> Open the model page. - <kbd>⇧</kbd> Quicklook preview the model page. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>C</kbd> Copy the model name. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Remove the model. - <kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Set as preferred model for inference.
### Loaded Models
![Ollama installed models](images/preview3.png)
- <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Unload the model.
### New Models
![Ollama new models](images/preview4.png)
Type to match models based on your query. - <kbd>↩</kbd> Open the model page. - <kbd>⇧</kbd> Quicklook preview the model page. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> View the unabridged model description as large type. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>C</kbd> Copy the model name. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Pull `model:latest` from registry. - <kbd>⌥</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> (or tap <kbd>⇥</kbd>) Inspect available versions of the model.
### Model Versions
![Ollama model versions](images/preview5.png)
Type to match versions based on your query. - <kbd>↩</kbd> Open the model page. - <kbd>⇧</kbd> Quicklook preview the model page. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>C</kbd> Copy the model name. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Pull `model:version` from registry.
### Pulling Models
![Ollama pull progress](images/preview6.png) - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Cancel the download.
### Local Chat
![Ollama local chat window preview](images/preview7.png)
#### Chat History
![Ollama local chat history preview](images/preview8.png)
- <kbd>↩</kbd> Continue archived conversation. - <kbd>⌥</kbd> View modification date. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Reveal the chat file in Finder. - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> Inspect the unabridged preview as [Large Type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type/). - <kbd>⌘</kbd><kbd>⇧</kbd><kbd>↩</kbd> Send conversation to the trash.
## Inference Actions
> Inference Actions provide a suite of language tools for text generation and transformation. These tools enable summarization, clarification, concise writing, and tone adjustment for selected text. They can also correct spelling, expand and paraphrase text, follow instructions, answer questions, and improve text in other ways.
Access a list of all available actions via the [Universal Action](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/universal-actions/) or by setting the [Hotkey](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) trigger.
![Ollama inference actions universal action preview](images/preview9.png)
![Ollama inference actions filter preview](images/preview10.png)
- <kbd>↩</kbd> __Stream__ the result to the frontmost application.
> __Warning:__ Make sure you only use this if the frontmost UI Element accepts text. > There are no security checks in place at the moment.
---
__Links__ * [ollama.com](https://ollama.com) * [Ollama Github FAQ](https://github.com/ollama/ollama/blob/main/docs/faq.md)
__Footnotes__ ¹ `xcode-select --install`
View chat history / continue previous chats
The temperature setting determines the balance between predictability and creativity in the language model's chat responses.
The context setting determines the point at which previously sent messages are ignored.

A system prompt is a way to provide context, instructions, and guidelines to a language model before presenting it with a question or task. By using a system prompt, you can set the stage for the conversation, specifying the model's role, personality, tone, or any other relevant information that will help it better understand and respond to your input.
